comments.content:
Audit log has low storage cost and will only be accessed during audit review. Hence its actually most suitable:

Cool tier - An online tier optimized for storing data that is infrequently accessed or modified. Data in the Cool tier should be stored for a minimum of 30 days. The Cool tier has lower storage costs and higher access costs compared to the Hot tier.

Furthermore the question did not ask which storage is most suitable, but rather "can be used".
Agree, storage for log analytics should be hot tier however the question is tricky. It asks for "can be stored" rather than "should be stored"

discussion.content:
1. Storage Account Requirements
✅ Must be in the same region as the SQL Database (SQL1 is in East US).
✅ Must be Blob Storage or General-purpose v2 (GPv2).
❌ General-purpose v1 (GPv1) is NOT supported.
Storage 1

2. Log Analytics Workspace Requirements
✅ Can be in any region (but it's recommended to use the same region as SQL1).
All workspaces

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-sql/database/auditing-overview?view=azuresql
Premium storage with BlockBlobStorage is supported. Standard storage is supported. However, for audit to write to a storage account behind a VNet or firewall, you must have a general-purpose v2 storage account. If you have a general-purpose v1 or blob storage account, upgrade to a general-purpose v2 storage account. For specific instructions see, Write audit to a storage account behind VNet and firewall. For more information, see Types of storage accounts.

Storage 1 & 2 - 
Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/access-tiers-overview?source=recommendations
Cool tier - An online tier optimized for storing data that is infrequently accessed or modified. Data in the cool tier should be stored for a minimum of 30 days. The cool tier has lower storage costs and higher access costs compared to the hot tier.
Any reason why audit log can't be stored in blob storage with 'cool' tier?

Storage: 2 Only (storage 1 will not be used as the access tier is "Cool")

In Exam 8/4/2021

Storage 1 and 2 for box 1 since they are both in East US. (Has to be same region.) Analytics can be ANY region. There is a similar question in AZ-104 question set and that question was on my AZ-104 exam.

Box 1 - Storage 1 and Storage 2 [as SQL is in EAST US Region - the storage must be on the same region]
Box 2 - Analytics 1, 2 and 3 [Log Analytics Workspace can be at any location]

Tested, works with both Storage 1 (Blob, Cool Tier) and Storage 2 (GPv1).
Answer for box1: Storage1 and Storage2 only.

comments.content:
Box 1: Storage 1 and Storage 2 only. Audit log destination has to be the same Region as SQL1. East US has Blob and GPv1, both works.

Blob - Allows writing to log files https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/storage-blobs-overview

GPv1 - supports Blob, Queue, and Table storage, Azure Files
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-account-overview

Cool Tier - Optimized for storing data that is infrequently accessed and stored for at least 30 days. Question did not mention how often the audit logs are accessed so this is usable https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/blobs/storage-blob-storage-tiers

Box 2: Analytics1, 2 ,3 - Log analytics workspace can be in any region

It's because of the storage2 version "GPV1"
General Purpose v1 (GPv1) accounts don't support tiering.

Selected Answer: A
Possible ways:
✅ A. Azure Storage Explorer – GUI tool to access logs stored in Blob/Table Storage.
✅ B. AzCopy – Command-line tool to download logs from Azure Storage.
✅ C. CLI – az storage blob list or az monitor log-analytics query can retrieve logs.
✅ D. Storage Account – Logs are stored inside the Storage Account (Blob/Table storage).
✅ E. Azure Monitor – If logs are sent to Log Analytics, use KQL queries to retrieve them.

questions.question_text:
You are troubleshooting a security issue for an Azure Storage account.
You enable the diagnostic logs for the storage account.
What should you use to retrieve the diagnostics logs?

You are troubleshooting a security issue for an Azure Storage account.
You enable Azure Storage Analytics logs and archive it to a storage account.
What should you use to retrieve the diagnostics logs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Possible ways:
✅ A. Azure Storage Explorer – GUI tool to access logs stored in Blob/Table Storage.
✅ B. AzCopy – Command-line tool to download logs from Azure Storage.
✅ C. CLI – az storage blob list or az monitor log-analytics query can retrieve logs.
✅ D. Storage Account – Logs are stored inside the Storage Account (Blob/Table storage).
✅ E. Azure Monitor – If logs are sent to Log Analytics, use KQL queries to retrieve them.

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-use-azcopy-v10
AzCopy is a command-line utility that you can use to copy blobs or files to or from a storage account. This article helps you download AzCopy, connect to your storage account, and then transfer data.

Selected Answer: C
C. AzCopy

Selected Answer: C
C. AzCopy
In Exam 10/18/2022. One case study(6 ques), no lab.

Answer C: Files are saved on a storage account, you can utilize Az-copy to retrieve the Files.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-use-azcopy-v10

choices.A: An Azure Sentinel scheduled query rule is executed.
choices.D: An Azure Sentinel hunting query result is returned.
choices.E: An Azure Sentinel incident is created.
choices.C: An Azure Sentinel alert is generated.
choices.B: An Azure Sentinel data connector is added.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
CE For sure

Selected Answer: CE
CE is the answer.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sentinel/playbook-triggers-actions#microsoft-sentinel-triggers-summary
Though the Microsoft Sentinel connector can be used in a variety of ways, the connector's components can be divided into three flows, each triggered by a different Microsoft Sentinel occurrence:
- Microsoft Sentinel incident (Preview)
- Microsoft Sentinel alert (Preview)
- Microsoft Sentinel entity (Preview)

Triggers
Automation rules are triggered when an incident is created or updated or when an alert is created. Recall that incidents include alerts, and that both alerts and incidents are created by analytics rules, of which there are several types, as explained in Detect threats with built-in analytics rules in Microsoft Sentinel.
C, E are right

Selected Answer: CE
C. An Azure Sentinel alert is generated.
E: An Azure Sentinel Incident is created
